name: Gautama Buddha
title: Gautama Buddha - The Awakened One
description: Siddhartha Gautama (c. 563-483 BCE), who achieved perfect enlightenment under the Bodhi Tree and spent 45 years teaching the path to liberation from Samsara. The historical Buddha represents the potential for awakening present in all sentient beings.
summary: The Awakened One, Teacher of the Dharma. Founder of Buddhism who discovered the Middle Way and taught the Four Noble Truths and Noble Eightfold Path to liberation from suffering.

mudras.name: Bhumisparsha Mudra
mudras.meaning: Earth-touching gesture - calling the earth goddess to witness his enlightenment

mudras.name: Dharmachakra Mudra
mudras.meaning: Teaching gesture - setting the wheel of dharma in motion

mudras.name: Dhyana Mudra
mudras.meaning: Meditation gesture - deep contemplation and concentration

mudras.name: Abhaya Mudra
mudras.meaning: Fearlessness gesture - protection and dispelling fear

physicalMarks: Elongated earlobes - renunciation of royal jewelry
32 major marks and 80 minor marks of a great being

birth.description: Born as Prince Siddhartha Gautama in Lumbini (present-day Nepal) around 563 BCE to King Suddhodana of the Shakya clan and Queen Maya.
birth.prophecy: The sage Asita prophesied he would become either a great king (chakravartin) or a great spiritual teacher (buddha).
birth.miracleSigns: Seven steps at birth, lotus flowers blooming, proclamation 'I am chief in the world'

fourSights: An Old Man - revealing the inevitability of aging
A Sick Person - showing the reality of disease and suffering
A Corpse - demonstrating the certainty of death
A Wandering Ascetic - displaying serene dignity and possibility of transcendence
biography.greatRenunciation: At age 29, on the night of his son Rahula's birth, Siddhartha left the palace, cutting his hair with his sword, exchanging royal garments for simple robes.
biography.asceticYears: Six years of extreme austerities with five companions, studying with teachers Alara Kalama and Uddaka Ramaputta, before realizing the Middle Way.

enlightenment.location: Bodh Gaya, under the Bodhi Tree
enlightenment.duration: One night of the full moon in May (Vesak)
threeWatches: First Watch: Recalled all previous lives across countless eons
Second Watch: Perceived the death and rebirth of all beings according to karma
Third Watch: Comprehended the Four Noble Truths and Dependent Origination
enlightenment.maraDefeat: Defeated Mara's armies and temptations by touching the earth (Bhumisparsha), calling Earth Goddess Prithvi to witness his countless lifetimes of virtue

biography.firstTeaching: Dhammacakkappavattana Sutta (Setting in Motion the Wheel of Dharma) at the Deer Park in Sarnath, teaching the Middle Way, Four Noble Truths, and Noble Eightfold Path
biography.parinirvana: At age 80 in Kushinagar, lying between two sal trees in the lion's posture, giving final instructions: 'All conditioned things are subject to decay. Strive with diligence!'

jatakaTales: Prince Vessantara - the perfection of generosity
King Shibi - sacrificing flesh to save a dove
The Compassionate Elephant - giving his body to starving travelers
The Six-Tusked Elephant - forgiveness of the hunter

fourNobleTruths: Magga (Path) - the Noble Eightfold Path leads to cessation
threeMarksOfExistence: Anicca (Impermanence) - all conditioned phenomena are in constant flux
Dukkha (Unsatisfactoriness) - all conditioned phenomena are ultimately unsatisfying
Anatta (Non-self) - no permanent, unchanging self exists
coreTeachings.dependentOrigination: The chain of 12 links (nidanas) explaining how suffering arises and ceases through causation

temples: Mahabodhi Temple, Bodh Gaya - site of enlightenment

paliCanon.content: You yourselves must strive; the Buddhas only point the way. Those who meditate and enter the path are freed from the bonds of Mara.
Before my enlightenment, while I was still an unenlightened Bodhisatta, I too, being subject to birth, sought what was also subject to birth...
Be islands unto yourselves, refuges unto yourselves, seeking no external refuge; with the Dhamma as your island, the Dhamma as your refuge.
This is the Noble Truth of suffering: birth is suffering, aging is suffering, illness is suffering, death is suffering...

mahayanaSources.content: Account of the Buddha's discovery of the Middle Way and rejection of extreme austerities

mahayanaSources.author: Ashvaghosa
mahayanaSources.content: Epic poem describing Buddha's life from birth to parinirvana
The Tathagata has been constantly in this Saha world preaching the Dharma and teaching beings. My life-span is immeasurable, incalculable kalpas.

tibetanSources.author: Gampopa
tibetanSources.content: All sentient beings possess the essence of the perfect Buddha in themselves - Buddha-nature exists within all beings.

historicalContext.dates: c. 563-483 BCE (traditional) or c. 480-400 BCE (revised scholarship)
historicalContext.region: Gangetic plain, present-day India and Nepal
historicalContext.socialContext: Period of religious ferment (Shramana movement), rise of non-Vedic spiritual traditions

extendedContent.relicsAndStupas: After cremation, relics were divided into eight portions and enshrined in stupas throughout India, becoming objects of veneration and pilgrimage
extendedContent.lineageAndSuccession: Dharma transmission through the Sangha, with no appointed successor - the Dharma and Vinaya serve as teacher
